modules.description: Provides functions to parse and generate big array literals at compile time, converting them into efficient runtime representations. Works with OCaml's bigarray type and related primitives for numerical data. Enables direct embedding of large numerical datasets in code, useful for scientific computing and data processing tasks.

Checks if a Bigarray layout is in C order. Handles various Bigarray types and layouts, enabling low-level memory management. Used to validate data alignment in generated code for interoperability with C libraries.

Provides functions to parse and generate Bigarray literals, including converting string representations of kinds and layouts to their corresponding types. Operates on nested matrix structures, location data, and Parsetree expressions to construct and manipulate array literals. Used to transform and validate Bigarray definitions during code processing or generation.
